Key Arguments: The legislation grants enhanced power to ACMA, which is problematic as they recommended the bill.
ACMA's role in determining misinformation implies they are judging truth, which is inappropriate for any government body.
The legislation will lead to self-censorship by publishers to avoid penalties, filtering out legitimate content.
Definitions of misinformation and disinformation evolve, and restricting content could hinder the natural progression of ideas.
The exclusion of government from the laws suggests recognition of the bill's flaws by its proponents.
Main Themes: Concerns about government overreach and power dynamics
Evolving nature of truth and information
Potential for self-censorship and chilling effects
Notable Quotes: The concept behind this legislation is abhorrent.
Governments of any stripe must never be allowed to make these judgement calls â€¦ EVER!
What is considered misinformation or disinformation changes over time.
